conversation.content: Wait. My package. It's not—where is it? I leave tomorrow morning. For vacation. Tomorrow!

Oh! Okay okay, I can definitely help you with that, um, let me just pull up your account here... I think I can—actually wait, what's your order number? I'll need that to, er, to check the tracking status for you.
It's ORD—no wait—let me find... ORD-4782-NX. But the tracking stopped. Three days ago. Nothing since then.

Alright so... hmm, I'm seeing ORD-4782-NX here and, uh, you're right, there's definitely something odd with the tracking. It shows it reached our facility in Memphis with code MEM-8823 but then it just—sorry, I mean it sort of stopped updating after that, which is probably why you're concerned.
Memphis? But I'm in California! How long—no, when will it—I literally leave at 6 AM!

Right right, I totally understand why that's stressful, especially with your trip tomorrow. So what I'm seeing is, um, it should've transferred to facility code LAX-9901 for California delivery, but there's maybe a scanning issue? Let me check something else real quick...
A scanning issue. Great. That's what they said last time and my package just... disappeared.

Oh gosh, yeah, I know that's frustrating when you've had problems before. Okay so, er, good news actually—I found it! It's at distribution center ZIP 90245, which is probably like twenty minutes from you, it just wasn't scanning properly.
Twenty minutes? So it's just... sitting there? Can I pick it up? Tonight?

Mmm, let me see what I can do here... the facility closes at 8 PM, but I could—wait actually, I think there's a better option. I can flag this as critical with code URGENT-VX7 and basically guarantee delivery by noon tomorrow?
Noon is too late! I told you. 6 AM flight. This is for the vacation—the whole trip depends on this!
Got it.
So there's nothing? After waiting. Three days. Of nothing. You're telling me there's...

No no no, wait, I'm not giving up! Sorry, I was just thinking... okay so, um, here's what I can do—and honestly this is kind of bending the rules—but I can authorize a same-day courier with service code RUSH-88K to pick it up right now.
Same day? Like... tonight? You're sure? Because people promise things and then...

I mean, I totally get why you're skeptical, but yeah, I'm putting it through right now. The courier confirmation is CRX-1147-B, and er, you'll get a text in probably five minutes with their ETA, which should be before 10 PM tonight.
Before ten. Okay. That could—that works. If it actually happens. You're certain?

Absolutely certain, I've already submitted it and, uh, I'm actually seeing the courier just accepted the job—driver ID 7739—so they're heading to the facility now. Look, I know it's been a mess, but this will definitely get there tonight.
Thank God. I just—this vacation has been planned for... anyway. Thank you. Really.

Hey, of course! I'm just really glad we could sort this out before your trip. Oh and, um, I added a $25 credit with code DELAY-25C to your account for all the trouble, which should show up in maybe two or three days.

scenario: desperate because they need this resolved before they leave for vacation tomorrow
